elements.title: William Nicholas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the bloody siege of Badajoz, William Nicholas (pictured) was wounded by musket-ball and bayonet, but continued to give orders and was carried up the breach, only to be shot again?

elements.title: Young Americans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Bowie frequently updated the lyrics for his song "Young Americans" to keep them contemporary?

elements.title: Juan López Mella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1991, Juan López Mella was the first Spanish rider to achieve a podium place in the Superbike World Championship?

elements.title: A Pickle for the Knowing Ones (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after complaints of A Pickle for the Knowing Ones lacking punctuation, the author published a second edition with full pages of punctuation in the appendix?

elements.title: Mercedes-Benz CLK GTR (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1998, the Mercedes-Benz CLK GTR received the Guinness World Record for the most expensive production car?

elements.title: Faces of War Memorial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1995 dedication ceremony for the Faces of War Memorial included missing-man flyovers?

elements.title: Polystoechotites (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fossils are included in Polystoechotites due to being poorly fossilized, rather than due to relation?

elements.title: Kalervo Kummola (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that politician Kalervo Kummola introduced karaoke to Finland?
